trans-unit.source: Getting Started with Active Directory Authentication - What Happened
trans-unit.target: Getting Started with Active Directory Authentication - What Happened

trans-unit.source: Describes what happened to your Azure Active Directory project in Visual Studio
trans-unit.target: Describes what happened to your Azure Active Directory project in Visual Studio

trans-unit.source: What happened to my project?
trans-unit.target: What happened to my project?

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.SELECTOR]
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.SELECTOR]

trans-unit.source: Getting Started
trans-unit.target: Getting Started

trans-unit.source: What Happened
trans-unit.target: What Happened

trans-unit.source: References have been added
trans-unit.target: References have been added

trans-unit.source: NuGet package references
trans-unit.target: NuGet package references

trans-unit.source: .NET references
trans-unit.target: .NET references

trans-unit.source: Code has been added
trans-unit.target: Code has been added

trans-unit.source: Code files were added to your project
trans-unit.target: Code files were added to your project

trans-unit.source: An authentication startup class, `App_Start/Startup.Auth.cs` was added to your project containing startup logic for Azure AD authentication.
trans-unit.target: An authentication startup class, `App_Start/Startup.Auth.cs` was added to your project containing startup logic for Azure AD authentication.

trans-unit.source: Also, a controller class, Controllers/AccountController.cs was added which contains `SignIn()` and `SignOut()` methods.
trans-unit.target: Also, a controller class, Controllers/AccountController.cs was added which contains `SignIn()` and `SignOut()` methods.

trans-unit.source: Finally, a partial view, `Views/Shared/_LoginPartial.cshtml` was added containing an action link for SignIn/SignOut.
trans-unit.target: Finally, a partial view, `Views/Shared/_LoginPartial.cshtml` was added containing an action link for SignIn/SignOut.

trans-unit.source: Startup code was added to your project
trans-unit.target: Startup code was added to your project

trans-unit.source: If you already had a Startup class in your project, the **Configuration** method was updated to include a call to `ConfigureAuth(app)`.
trans-unit.target: If you already had a Startup class in your project, the **Configuration** method was updated to include a call to `ConfigureAuth(app)`.

trans-unit.source: Otherwise, a Startup class was added to your project.
trans-unit.target: Otherwise, a Startup class was added to your project.

trans-unit.source: Your app.config or web.config has new configuration values
trans-unit.target: Your app.config or web.config has new configuration values

trans-unit.source: The following configuration entries have been added.
trans-unit.target: The following configuration entries have been added.

source.ph: `<appSettings> <add key="ida:ClientId" value="ClientId from the new Azure AD App" /> <add key="ida:AADInstance" value="https://login.microsoftonline.com/" /> <add key="ida:Domain" value="The selected Azure AD Domain" /> <add key="ida:TenantId" value="The Id of your selected Azure AD Tenant" /> <add key="ida:PostLogoutRedirectUri" value="Your project start page" /> </appSettings>`

target.ph: `<appSettings> <add key="ida:ClientId" value="ClientId from the new Azure AD App" /> <add key="ida:AADInstance" value="https://login.microsoftonline.com/" /> <add key="ida:Domain" value="The selected Azure AD Domain" /> <add key="ida:TenantId" value="The Id of your selected Azure AD Tenant" /> <add key="ida:PostLogoutRedirectUri" value="Your project start page" /> </appSettings>`

trans-unit.source: An Azure Active Directory (AD) App was created
trans-unit.target: An Azure Active Directory (AD) App was created

trans-unit.source: An Azure AD Application was created in the directory that you selected in the wizard.
trans-unit.target: An Azure AD Application was created in the directory that you selected in the wizard.

trans-unit.source: If I checked *disable Individual User Accounts authentication*, what additional changes were made to my project?
trans-unit.target: If I checked *disable Individual User Accounts authentication*, what additional changes were made to my project?

trans-unit.source: NuGet package references were removed, and files were removed and backed up.
trans-unit.target: NuGet package references were removed, and files were removed and backed up.

trans-unit.source: Depending on the state of your project, you may have to manually remove additional references or files, or modify code as appropriate.
trans-unit.target: Depending on the state of your project, you may have to manually remove additional references or files, or modify code as appropriate.

trans-unit.source: NuGet package references removed (for those present)
trans-unit.target: NuGet package references removed (for those present)

trans-unit.source: Code files backed up and removed (for those present)
trans-unit.target: Code files backed up and removed (for those present)

trans-unit.source: Each of following files was backed up and removed from the project.
trans-unit.target: Each of following files was backed up and removed from the project.

trans-unit.source: Backup files are located in a 'Backup' folder at the root of the project's directory.
trans-unit.target: Backup files are located in a 'Backup' folder at the root of the project's directory.

trans-unit.source: Code files backed up (for those present)
trans-unit.target: Code files backed up (for those present)

trans-unit.source: Each of following files was backed up before being replaced.
trans-unit.target: Each of following files was backed up before being replaced.

trans-unit.source: Backup files are located in a 'Backup' folder at the root of the project's directory.
trans-unit.target: Backup files are located in a 'Backup' folder at the root of the project's directory.

trans-unit.source: If I checked *Read directory data*, what additional changes were made to my project?
trans-unit.target: If I checked *Read directory data*, what additional changes were made to my project?

trans-unit.source: Additional references have been added.
trans-unit.target: Additional references have been added.

trans-unit.source: Additional NuGet package references
trans-unit.target: Additional NuGet package references

trans-unit.source: Additional .NET references
trans-unit.target: Additional .NET references

trans-unit.source: Additional Code files were added to your project
trans-unit.target: Additional Code files were added to your project

trans-unit.source: Two files were added to support token caching: `Models\ADALTokenCache.cs` and `Models\ApplicationDbContext.cs`.
trans-unit.target: Two files were added to support token caching: `Models\ADALTokenCache.cs` and `Models\ApplicationDbContext.cs`.

trans-unit.source: An additional controller and view were added to illustrate accessing user profile information using Azure graph APIs.
trans-unit.target: An additional controller and view were added to illustrate accessing user profile information using Azure graph APIs.

trans-unit.source: These files are `Controllers\UserProfileController.cs` and `Views\UserProfile\Index.cshtml`.
trans-unit.target: These files are `Controllers\UserProfileController.cs` and `Views\UserProfile\Index.cshtml`.

trans-unit.source: Additional Startup code was added to your project
trans-unit.target: Additional Startup code was added to your project

trans-unit.source: In the `startup.auth.cs` file, a new `OpenIdConnectAuthenticationNotifications` object was added to the `Notifications` member of the `OpenIdConnectAuthenticationOptions`.
trans-unit.target: In the `startup.auth.cs` file, a new `OpenIdConnectAuthenticationNotifications` object was added to the `Notifications` member of the `OpenIdConnectAuthenticationOptions`.

trans-unit.source: This is to enable receiving the OAuth code and exchange it for an access token.
trans-unit.target: This is to enable receiving the OAuth code and exchange it for an access token.

trans-unit.source: Additional changes were made to your app.config or web.config
trans-unit.target: Additional changes were made to your app.config or web.config

trans-unit.source: The following additional configuration entries have been added.
trans-unit.target: The following additional configuration entries have been added.

source.ph: `<appSettings> <add key="ida:ClientSecret" value="Your Azure AD App's new client secret" /> </appSettings>`

target.ph: `<appSettings> <add key="ida:ClientSecret" value="Your Azure AD App's new client secret" /> </appSettings>`

trans-unit.source: The following configuration sections and connection string have been added.
trans-unit.target: The following configuration sections and connection string have been added.

trans-unit.source: Your Azure Active Directory App was updated
trans-unit.target: Your Azure Active Directory App was updated

trans-unit.source: Your Azure Active Directory App was updated to include the *Read directory data* permission and an additional key was created which was then used as the *ida:ClientSecret* in the `web.config` file.
trans-unit.target: Your Azure Active Directory App was updated to include the *Read directory data* permission and an additional key was created which was then used as the *ida:ClientSecret* in the `web.config` file.

trans-unit.source: Learn more about Azure Active Directory
trans-unit.target: Learn more about Azure Active Directory

trans-unit.source: test
trans-unit.target: test
